required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Preliminary Evaluation of Alternative Approaches to Combustible Cigarette Cessation (Exchange Project Sub-Study)
clinical_study.official_title: A Needs Survey of Urban Day Shelter Users and Preliminary Evaluation of Alternative Approaches to Combustible Cigarette Cessation: The Exchange Project

brief_summary.textblock:
This sub-study component (n = 60) of The Exchange Project will:
characterize reductions in cigarette smoking following the provision of: 1) an e-cigarette device (JUUL) and supplies (device charger, JUULpods), 2) financial incentives for biochemically-verified cigarette cessation + standard nicotine replacement therapy, or 3) JUUL + financial incentives for cigarette cessation, among homeless adults randomized to 1 of the 3 intervention arms.

detailed_description.textblock: Sub-study participants will be randomly assigned to: 1) earn incentives for quitting smoking based on a previously developed incentive schedule for socioeconomically disadvantaged and homeless adults in addition to combination nicotine replacement therapy (patches + lozenges), 2) the provision of an e-cigarette device (JUUL)/supplies (JUULpods) along with directions to switch over from combustible cigarettes to e-cigarettes exclusively, or 3) the combination of an e-cigarette device (JUUL)/supplies (JUULpods) and incentives for combustible cigarette cessation. In all groups, cigarette smoking will be monitored over a 4-week period to characterize reductions in cigarette smoking and rates of smoking cessation. It is anticipated that individuals who are provided with an e-cigarette device and supplies, and are also incentivized for completely switching from cigarette smoking to e-cigarette use will show the greatest reductions in cigarette smoking and be the most likely to stop smoking combustible cigarettes altogether. The long-term objective of the sub-study is to identify strategies to help homeless adults quit smoking or switch to e-cigarettes as a harm reduction strategy.

primary_outcome.description: Self-reported cigarette smoking abstinence during the previous 7 days (at 4 weeks post-quit/switch), corroborated with an exhaled carbon monoxide level of < 6 ppm.

Self-reported cigarette smoking abstinence during the previous 7 days (at 4 weeks post-quit/switch), corroborated with an exhaled carbon monoxide level of < 6 ppm. JUUL use reported during the past 7 days.

secondary_outcome.description: The total number of JUUL devices lost by participants during the study.
Average total amount earned by participants (out of $150) for biochemically-verified abstinence.

arm_group.description: Participants will receive combination nicotine replacement therapy (lozenges + patches), along with weekly financial incentives for biochemically-verified abstinence during the first 4 weeks following a scheduled quit attempt.
Participants will be asked to completely switch from cigarettes to e-cigarettes. They will receive a JUUL e-cigarette device and JUULpods during the first 4 weeks following a scheduled switch date.

Participants will be asked to completely switch from cigarettes to e-cigarettes, and they will receive a JUUL e-cigarette device and JUULpods during the first 4 weeks following a scheduled switch date. Participants will also receive weekly financial incentives for biochemically-verified cigarette abstinence during the first 4 weeks following the switch date.

intervention.description: Participants will receive nicotine replacement therapy (NRT) and the opportunity to earn weekly financial incentives, credited to a gift card with biochemical evidence of smoking abstinence during the first 4 weeks following a scheduled quit date.

Participants will receive a JUUL/e-cigarette device and JUUL pods. Each participant in this group will be yoked to a participant in the financial incentives group, thus receiving equal payments. Yoking will reduce or eliminate differential attendance rates between groups because participants have the opportunity to earn the same amount of money regardless of group assignment. Participants will be followed for the first 4 weeks following a scheduled quit attempt.

Participants will receive a JUUL/e-cigarette device and JUUL pods and the opportunity to earn financial incentives for biochemically-verified cigarette smoking abstinence, credited to a gift card with biochemical evidence of smoking abstinence during the first 4 weeks following a scheduled quit attempt.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. > 6th grade English literacy level
2. ≥ 18 years of age
3. an expired carbon monoxide (CO) level ≥ 8 ppm (suggestive of current smoking)
4. currently smoking ≥ 5 cigarettes per day
5. willing and able to attend 6 weekly study visits over a 5 week period
6. interest in switching from smoking cigarettes to using e-cigarettes
7. motivation to quit smoking in the near future
8. have not smoked marijuana in the past 30 days
9. have not used e-cigarettes in the past 30 days
10. not pregnant or breast feeding or planning to become pregnant
Exclusion Criteria:
1. < 6th grade English literacy level
2. < 18 years of age
3. an expired CO level < 8 ppm
4. currently smoking < 5 cigarettes per day
5. unwilling and unable to attend 6 weekly study visits over a 5 week period
6. no interest in switching from smoking cigarettes to using e-cigarettes
7. no motivation to quit smoking in the near future
8. have smoked marijuana in the past 30 days
9. have used e-cigarettes in the past 30 days
10. pregnant or breast feeding or planning to become pregnant
